inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: 48 M with a h/o HTN hyperlipidemia, bicuspid aortic valve, and tobacco abuse

inclusion.criterion: patients with severe symptomatic aortic stenosis secondary to degenerative disease
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: TTE revealed severe aortic stenosis with worsening LV function. EF was 25%

inclusion.criterion: confirmed by transthoracic echocardiography (mean gradient >40 mmHg and/or valve area <1 cm2)
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: repeat echo confirmed critical aortic stenosis showing left ventricular hypertrophy with cavity dilation and severe global hypokinesis, severe aortic valve stenosis

inclusion.criterion: with significant coronary artery disease (epicardial coronary stenosis angiography > or = to 50%)
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: cardiac cath with right heart cath to evaluate his pulm art pressures which showed no angiographically apparent flow-limiting coronary artery disease

inclusion.criterion: Active contraceptive method is recommended for female of childbearing age
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Severe CAD with tritroncular lesions or severe stenosis (>90 %) of left main artery or proximal left anterior descending artery
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: cardiac cath with right heart cath to evaluate his pulm art pressures which showed no angiographically apparent flow-limiting coronary artery disease

exclusion.criterion: Lack of viability in myocardial territory of interest
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of bypass coronary surgery or heart transplantation
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger

exclusion.criterion: Severe left ventricular systolic dysfunction, characterized by an ejection fraction < 35 %
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Severe renal impairment (Creatinine clearance <30 ml/min/1.73 m2)
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient's ejection fraction is below the threshold for severe left ventricular systolic dysfunction, which may trigger exclusion.
